ygData.subject: RE: Brad On Binding (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh I give in, you ve won.  =) I am guessing that you re a female (as your email adress has sarah in it). And the usual saying Never argue with a woman
ygData.messageBody:
Oh I give in, you've won. =)
I am guessing that you're a female (as your email adress has sarah in it).
And the usual saying "Never argue with a woman" <sighs>

Madagan, 33 Bard - Veeshan




"Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...> on 12/01/2000 16:48:16

Please respond to eqbards@onelist.com

To: eqbards@onelist.com
cc: (bcc: John Senior/M&G)
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Brad On Binding (OT)



----------


From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>

Mr. Senior, we ALL pay for our time -- for some it is just more
obvious than for others. If you are paying by the
minute, then playing an engrossing online game may be too high
an expense to begin with, whether or not you can bind nearby.
I have friends with over 100 days played time. Even friends
that can bind nearby, etc.

Some of my friends in England, though are on unlimited plans. They
are evidently expensive. But that is how they keep their phone
bills from skyrocketing. It is not Verant's fault that England
does their billing of phone calls that way.

Brad has addressed this question. He has said it's not changing Feel free
to complain about it still But nothing is going to change. So its just
complaining at this point.

>-----Original Message-----
>From: John_Senior@... [mailto:John_Senior@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, January 12, 2000 8:32 AM
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Brad On Binding (OT)
>
>
>From: John_Senior@...
>
>
>Yeah, it's still a risk that we shouldn't have to take, if one of those
>bouncers gets a stun on you then you're dead, especially as there are 2
>outside oggok.
>
>I just think that bind affinity should work in all outsdoor zones (be it a
>city, swamp, desert, commons etc), and there should be a Yes/No box like
>res, this way people can't bind someone where they don't want to be bound.
>This would stop people from binding inside dungeons and save peoples time
>if they die.
>
>I come from England and over here we have to pay for our calls, they are
>charged by the minute. Now this soon adds up and when I have to waste time
>running across 6 zones to my corpse I'm gonna be pissed. Aswell as having
>to mem songs and spend an hour getting back the exp I lost. My monthly
>phone bill is roughly ´┐¢100-120, in $ I would probably say it is about
>$150-175 per month. If you had to pay that then I think you'd be
>complaining.
>
>Anyway, I've rambled enough, I don't want to start a flame war or anything
>just my view on the subject.
>
>
>
>
>
>James Schuldes <jgs@...> on 12/01/2000 16:17:48
>
>Please respond to eqbards@onelist.com
>
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>cc: (bcc: John Senior/M&G)
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Brad On Binding (OT)
>
>
>
> ----------
>
>From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
>I thought we settled this issue...
>
>bring extra flutes
>bag everything and fill as many main slots with extra flutes as you can
>zone into Ogg
>get binded there
>duel your friend and get killed
>loot every thing except the flutes
>
>Now you have a storage corpse - complete with a night's supply of flutes.
>Do
>this a few times and you will see that the storage corpse and flute thing
>is
>more of a bother than a help and soon you will either selos or sneak by
any
>bouncers that are not camped.
>
>Sylly
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: John_Senior@...
>[mailto:John_Senior@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, January 12, 2000 5:53 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Brad On Binding (OT)
>
> From: John_Senior@...
>
> I find it an insult that when fighting in Cazic, Guk or the
>Sol's I have to
> run all the way from Freeport or Arena just to get back to
>my corpse,
>
>
